column3:
It was Jessie Bear's birthday. She was having a party.  She asked her two best friends to
ewlinecome to the party.  She made a big cake, and hung up some balloons.
ewline
ewlineSoon her friend Lion came over. Then her friend Tiger came over. Lion and Tiger brought
ewlinepresents with them.
ewline
ewlineJessie hugged her friends. She asked them if they would like to have cake. 
ewline
ewlineYes! said Lion. Yes yes! said Tiger. Jessie cut the cake, and they all ate it together.
ewlineThen Jessie opened her presents. She got a new jump rope and a fun game.  She asked Lion
ewlineand Tiger to play the game with her.
ewline
ewlineThe friends played and played. They all had a good time. Soon it was time for the party to
ewlinebe over.
ewline
ewlineLion and Tiger hugged Jessie and said goodbye to her.  Thanks for a great birthday! Jessie
ewlineBear told her two best friends.
column4: one: Who was having a birthday?

column3:
Sally had a very exciting summer vacation. She went to summer camp for the first time. She
ewlinemade friends with a girl named Tina. They shared a bunk bed in their cabin. Sally's
ewlinefavorite activity was walking in the woods because she enjoyed nature. Tina liked arts and
ewlinecrafts. Together, they made some art using leaves they found in the woods. Even after she
ewlinefell in the water, Sally still enjoyed canoeing. She was sad when the camp was over, but
ewlinepromised to keep in touch with her new friend.
ewline
ewlineSally went to the beach with her family in the summer as well. She loves the beach. Sally
ewlinecollected shells and mailed some to her friend, Tina, so she could make some arts and
ewlinecrafts with them. Sally liked fishing with her brothers, cooking on the grill with her dad,
ewlineand swimming in the ocean with her mother.
ewline
ewlineThe summer was fun, but Sally was very excited to go back to school. She missed her
ewlinefriends and teachers. She was excited to tell them about her summer vacation.
column4: multiple: Who went to the beach with Sally?
column9: multiple: What did Sally promise to do?
column13: Keep in touch with her new friend, Tina.
column14: one: Why does Sally like walking in the woods?
column16: She likes to play hide and go seek.
column19: multiple: What did Sally do this summer?
column20: She went to summer camp and the beach.

column3:
Todd lived in a town outside the city . Unlike the city the town was peaceful and quiet
ewlineand full of trees, flowers and animals.  One day his dad came in from work and said "Come
ewlineon, son, I'm going to take you to the city." Todd was very exited so he put on his shoes
ewlineand ran to the car.  When they got to the city Todd was very surprised there were so many
ewlinecars and people, everyone seemed to be in a hurry. There were no trees, no flowers, and no
ewlineanimals. Todd was so happy to get back home.  When his mom asked him about his trip to the
ewlinecity Todd said,"There's no place like home."

column9: multiple: What did Todd say when he got home from the city?

column11: There were so many people in cars.

column3:
Greta ran to the corner with her older brother Tony.  He had money for the ice cream truck
ewlinein his pocket and she was very happy. The ice cream truck had been parked at the curb
ewlinewaiting for children for a very long time.  The ice cream truck driver thought that no
ewlinemore children were coming to get ice cream so he started pulling away from the curb when
ewlinethey got to the corner. They yelled.  They screamed, "Stop! Stop!" and jumped up and down
ewlineon the side walk trying to get him to see them. The driver of the truck saw them, waved at
ewlinethem and smiled, pulled back to the curb and opened his truck up so that they could see
ewlineeverything that he had for sale.  They were so excited. They saw some new treats. Tony
ewlinewanted to try something new. He got an ice cream sundae with chocolate ice cream and
ewlinenuts. He almost got a snow cone. Greta looked at everything that the ice cream truck
ewlinehad. She saw candy, ice cream cones, snow cones, and everything else. It all looked so
ewlinegood. But after looking at everything, she wanted to get an ice cream sandwich. She got
ewlinethe ice cream sandwich. She bit into it and smiled. It tasted so good. She felt so
ewlinehappy. Her brother, Tony, was happy too. He bit into his ice cream cone sundae and
ewlinegrinned.  They walked home with their ice cream and told their mom about how close they
ewlinecame to not getting their ice cream at all. Their mom was happy that the truck had stopped
ewlinefor them. She said that they were very lucky to have gotten to the curb before the ice
ewlinecream truck left.
column4: multiple: What did the driver of the ice cream truck do when Greta and Tony got to the corner?
column5: He started pulling away from the curb.
column7: He stayed parked at the curb.
column8: He almost got a snow cone.

column12: They stood on the corner and cried.
column14: multiple: What did Tony and Greta get from the iced cream truck?
column15: Tony got a snow cone. Greta got an ice cream sundae.
column16: Tony got a snow cone. Greta got an iced cream cone with chocolate iced cream and nuts.
column17: Tony got an ice cream sundae with chocolate ice cream and nuts.
column18: Greta and Tony ice cream cones.
column19: multiple: What did Greta and Tony do after they got their ice cream?
column20: They walked to a friend's house and talked to his mother about what happened.

column3:
My parents, Kelly and Kelley, said that it was that time of year to take a family
ewlinevacation.  We've been to big ride parks that have hotels with large pools.  This year my
ewlineparents wanted to do something different.  They wanted to take us all to Elk River Castle.
ewline
ewlineAfter lots of planning we hit the road for our trip.  My Brother Kelsey and I enjoyed the
ewlinelong car ride there.
ewline  
ewlineOnce we arrive, the castle looked much bigger than we had imagined.  There was so much to
ewlinesee and so much to do.  There was a swimming pool, movie theater and an elevator to take
ewlineus from floor to floor.  What a magical place!  I was so excited because we had the whole
ewlineplace to our family!
ewline  
ewlineWe spent our vacation playing around the huge castle and finding small mysterious places.
ewlineThere was even a tiny room in the back of one of the closets.  My brother, Kelsey, and I
ewlineplayed hide and go seek for hours, watched movies and swam until the sun went down.
ewline
ewlineIt was sad when our vacation finally came to an end but we made some amazing memories.
ewlineWe'll never forget our trip to Elk River Castle!
column4: one: What was my brother's name?
column9: one: Where did we go?
column14: multiple: What did the castle have?
column19: multiple: What did we do at the castle?

column3:
Once upon a time there a little girl named Ana. Ana was a smart girl. Everyone in Ana's
ewlineschool knew and liked her very much. She had a big dream of becoming spelling bee
ewlinewinner. Ana studied very hard to be the best she could be at spelling. Ana's best friend
ewlinewould help her study every day after school. By the time the spelling bee arrived Ana and
ewlineher best friend were sure she would win. There were ten students in the spelling bee. This
ewlinemade Ana very nervous, but when she looked out and saw her dad cheering her on she knew
ewlineshe could do it. The spelling bee had five rounds and Ana made it through them all. She
ewlinewas now in the finals. During the final round James, the boy she was in the finals with, was
ewlinegiven a really hard word and he spelled it wrong. All Ana had to do was spell this last
ewlineword and she would be the winner. Ana stepped to the microphone, thought really hard and
ewlinespelled the word. She waited and finally her teacher said "That is correct". Ana had won
ewlinethe spelling bee. Ana was so happy. She won a trophy. Ana also won a big yellow
ewlineribbon. The whole school was also happy, and everyone clapped for her. The whole school
ewlinewent outside. They had a picnic to celebrate Ana winning.
column4: multiple: What made Ana very nervous?
column9: multiple: Where did the school have the picnic?

column3:
Roger was a grasshopper. He loved to hop. He hopped everywhere by himself. One day when he
ewlinewas hopping around he bumped into a frog sitting on a log. The frog told him his name was
ewlineGilbert. Gilbert told Roger that it had been a long time since he bumped into
ewlineanybody. Roger told him that since both grasshoppers and frogs like to jump they would
ewlinemake great friends. The next day they were hopping through a field and they saw something
ewlinevery strange.  In a pond they saw a spider floating on a lily pad. The spider was very sad
ewlinebecause he did not have any friends. Roger and Gilbert asked him why he didn't have any
ewlinefriends. The spider told them that everybody would scream and run away when they saw him.
ewlineRoger and Gilbert told him that he didn't look scary to them and that he could come along
ewlinewith them if he wanted. So Sam the spider said yes, and the three of them began a life
ewlinetime friendship full of adventures.

column3:
The cute red ball rolled over to the blue ball and said hello. The blue ball was scared
ewlineand went to cry to the green ball. The green ball laughed at the blue ball. Then the green
ewlineball told the orange ball that blue ball was stupid. Most felt this was not good to do and
ewlineso they punished the green ball by taking away all his air.
ewline
ewlineFrom that day on everyone saw the air-less green ball and knew that they could not do or
ewlinesay any bad things. This is how the trouble started. The purple ball used the fear of
ewlineeveryone to become the leader that they all feared. The purple ball was mean to
ewlineeveryone. Until one day the red ball spoke up and got all the other colored balls together
ewlineand they took the air from the purple ball and put it in the green ball. Sadly, the green
ewlineball had been without air for too long and was dead.

column3:
Sara wanted to play on a baseball team. She had never tried to swing a bat and hit a
ewlinebaseball before. Her Dad gave her a bat and together they went to the park to
ewlinepractice. Sara wondered if she could hit a ball. She wasn't sure if she would be any
ewlinegood. She really wanted to play on a team and wear a real uniform. She couldn't wait to
ewlineget to the park and test out her bat. When Sara and her Dad reached the park, Sara grabbed
ewlinethe bat and stood a few steps away from her Dad. Sara waited as her Dad pitched the ball
ewlineto her. Her heart was beating fast. She missed the first few pitches. She felt like
ewlinequitting but kept trying. Soon she was hitting the ball very far. She was very happy and
ewlineshe couldn't wait to sign up for a real team. Her Dad was very proud of her for not giving
ewlineup.

column3:
Peter was a very sad puppy.  He had been inside of the pet store for a very long time.  In
ewlinefact, he had been there for three months!  Peter had seen many other puppies find a
ewlineperson; he began to wonder why he could not get one.  He thought that maybe his fur was
ewlinenot pretty enough or maybe his bark was not loud enough.  He tried and tried to please
ewlineevery person who came to the store, but they all picked smaller puppies.  However, one day
ewlineall of this changed.  Sammie came into the store looking for a golden puppy.  She wanted a
ewlinepuppy she could snuggle with.  It so happened that Peter was very sad and tired that day.
ewlineSammie came to hold him.  Peter wanted to show off his bark, but he was too tired.  He
ewlinefell right to sleep.  Sammie loved him at once and loved holding him in her arms.  Sammie
ewlinetook Peter home that day, and they made lots of fun memories.

column3:
Luna the hawk wanted some socks. It was the middle of winter and sitting on tree branches
ewlinemade her feet very cold. Luna hoped that her friends could help her find some socks. She
ewlineflew to the old maple tree where Olive the owl lived.
ewline
ewline"Olive, may I please borrow a pair of your socks?" she asked.
ewline
ewlineOlive the owl looked surprised. "Luna, I have no use for socks because my legs and toes
ewlinehave thick feathers. Go visit one of the animals that walk on four legs. They might have
ewlineextra socks you could borrow."
ewline
ewlineLuna flew across the field and landed next to the icy creek. Rose the raccoon was teaching
ewlineher six babies how to wash their paws. The water was very cold, but the babies were having
ewlinefun.
ewline
ewline"Rose, my bare legs and bare toes are so cold, may I please borrow a pair of your socks?"
ewlinebegged Luna.
ewline
ewlineRose laughed hard. "Silly Luna, I do not have socks. Look at my legs and feet. They are
ewlinecovered with thick, warm fur. I'm sorry I cannot help you. Go visit the humans. Sometimes
ewlineI tip over their garbage cans at night when I am looking for food. Once I saw a pair of
ewlinesocks."
ewline
ewlineLuna was very afraid of humans. Her grandmother and mother had warned her about them. She
ewlinewas told that some humans are mean and hurt hawks. Her feet were so cold that it was
ewlinedifficult to grip tree branches. She became brave. She flew to the farmhouse on the big
ewlinehill. When she landed on the roof, she could not believe her eyes. She saw socks! In late
ewlineautumn, Henrietta the human had put laundry outside to dry and she had forgotten to bring
ewlinein one tiny pair of socks. The socks were hanging on the clothesline by two wooden
ewlinepins. Luna used her powerful beak to break the pins. She put on the socks and then flew
ewlineback to her home in the huge tree. When she landed, her feet were warm and dry. Luna was
ewlinevery happy.
column4: one: Why did Olive the owl not have any socks?
column5: She had given her socks to another friend.
column6: All of her socks were in the dirty laundry.
column7: She has thick feathers on her legs and toes.
column8: She wore ski boots instead of socks.
column9: multiple: Why was Luna afraid of humans?
column10: Her grandmother and mother had told stories about mean humans hurting hawks.
column12: Humans put garbage in the hawks' nests.
column13: Humans stole all of the hawks' food.
column14: multiple: Which animal did Luna not visit?
column19: multiple: How could the baby raccoons play in the icy creek without hurting their paws?
column20: Because their mother made sure they had warm mittens to keep their paws dry.
column21: Because their mother taught them how to play in the water without getting cold.
column22: Because their legs and feet are tough from tipping over garbage cans.
column23: Because their legs and feet have a thick covering of fur that keeps them warm.

column3:
Once upon a time a young boy and young girl set out on a trip to the beach. They packed a
ewlinefew towels, an umbrella, a few beach chairs and a lunch cooler. They drove to the crowded
ewlinebeach parking lot and spent almost an hour trying to find a parking spot. Once they found
ewlinea spot they parked and began walking to the beach area. They found a nice spot with a good
ewlineview of the water and set up their belongings. Once they sat down they began to enjoy a
ewlinenice lunch on the beach. They watched the boats go by and people playing in the water. It
ewlinewas a wonderful day and one they would always remember. Once they arrived home they
ewlinesuddenly found out that they both had a pretty good sunburn. They both said that next time
ewlinethey would use sun screen.

column3:
Three little kids lived in a great big house with a great big cat and many places for a
ewlinegreat big cat to hide.  Their great big cat was named Cowboy.  And Cowboy was not a very
ewlinenice cat.  Cowboy liked to bite and chew and scratch a great many things.  When Cowboy was
ewlinehappy, which was not very often, Cowboy liked to bite in to a blanket or soft toy and
ewlinecarry it around in his mouth.  When Cowboy was hungry he liked to bite bright red tomatoes
ewlineand suck out all the juice and seeds.  And when Cowboy was feeling mean he liked to hide.
ewlineCowboy would hide, curled up tight in a ball under a blanket or behind a corner and wait
ewlinefor one of the little kids to pass by.  When they did pass by Cowboy would jump at their
ewlinefeet and try to bite and scratch them.  He did not know that what he was doing was not
ewlinevery nice.  Cowboy was only a cat.  A great big cat that did not know any better.

column3:
On the first day of school, Mrs. Law asked all the students to write a story telling her
ewlinewhat they did over the summer. She told the students that they were going to read them in
ewlinefront of the class. This was going to help everyone get to know more about each other.
ewline
ewlineWhen all the students were done writing their stories, Anna raised her hand to read hers
ewlinefirst. Mrs. Law smiled at Anna's excitement to share her story with the class. She told
ewlineall the students to sit down and listen to Anna.
ewline
ewlineAnna started reading her story. All the other students quickly paid attention, as her
ewlinestory was telling about her vacation to a park with lots of rides. Anna told them that she
ewlinerode a huge ride called, "Superman," which was her favorite. After Anna finished reading
ewlineher story, all the students clapped and said that they wished that they could hear
ewlinemore. Anna told them to tell their mommies and daddies to take them to visit the rides
ewlinenext summer.

column3:
This is a story about a bear and a wolf. The bear met the wolf one day in the woods. The
ewlinebear said to the wolf, would you like to go to the river with me? The wolf said yes, he
ewlinewould like to go to the river. When the bear and the wolf got to the river they found that
ewlinea beaver had built a bridge to the other side of the river. The bear and the wolf crossed
ewlinethe bridge that was built by the beaver and found that they were now in a part of the
ewlinewoods they had never seen before. A little worried that they may get lost in this part of
ewlinethe woods they had never seen before the bear and the wolf turned around. They went back
ewlineover the bridge and were happy to be back in a part of the woods they knew so well. The
ewlinebeaver thanked both the bear and the wolf for trying out his new bridge and then started
ewlineto build yet another bridge close to the first bridge. He was a very busy beaver.

column3:
Jenny's family lived in a small apartment in Seattle.  One day Jenny came home from school
ewlineand her mom told her that the family was moving to Utah.  Jenny was sad to leave her
ewlinefriends. Jenny was sad to leave her school.  Jenny helped her mom pack boxes and clean
ewlinetheir apartment to get ready for the move.  Soon the day came when Jenny's dad brought a
ewlinelarge truck to the parking lot and all of the family's things were put inside.  Jenny and
ewlineher mom rode in their car and her dad drove the truck towards Utah.  Jenny loved getting
ewlineto eat lots of yummy fast food on the way.  When the family got to their new home in Utah,
ewlineJenny helped her parents to take all of the boxes into the house.  She loved her new
ewlinebedroom!  When Jenny was emptying box of her toys, there was a knock at the door.  It was
ewlinea little girl who wanted Jenny to play! Jenny was going to like Utah!

column3:
Mike and Jeff are close friends. Their school is having a guessing game to guess how many
ewlinegumballs are in a box. If they get the right amount they win $100. If they get close they
ewlineget a $20 gift card. The box looks like it is missing some gumballs. It turns out some
ewlinepeople are eating them when they place their guess. 100 people guessed and took a piece of
ewlinecandy. The box is 10" by 10" by 10". Each gumball is 1" each. Mike guessed 500. Jeff
ewlineguessed 800. They both said they would split their money they win, if they win.

column3:
Hannah and her friend Mary were bored.  They sat around the house and tried to think about
ewlinewhat to do.  They petted the cat.  They drew pictures in Hannah's notebook.  They snuck
ewlineinto Hannah's mother's closet to try on her shoes, but Hannah's mother caught them.  She
ewlinesaid, "You girls need something to do.  Let's take a walk to the park!" Hannah and Mary
ewlinelooked at each other, and then jumped up and down happily.  "The park sounds great!" said
ewlineHannah.  "Let's go!" cried Mary.  So Hannah's mother packed up a snack of apples and
ewlinecookies, and they all set off to walk to the park.  They walked down the sidewalk, looking
ewlineat all the interesting things along the way.  Mary spotted a squirrel.  Hannah saw a
ewlineyellow bird.  Hannah's mother pointed out the pretty yellow flowers growing in front of
ewlineMr. Smith's house.  When they got to the park, Hannah's mother spread out a picnic blanket
ewlineand the snack.  Hannah and Mary ran around chasing butterflies for a little time, and then
ewlinesat down to eat their snacks.  When they finished, Hannah's mother put the leftovers in a
ewlinetrash can.  As they walked back home, Hannah thought that the boring day had turned out
ewlinequite well.
column4: one: What did Hannah and Mary chase at the park?
column9: one: What did Hannah's mother do with the leftovers?
column12: Put it in the trash can
column14: multiple: What did Hannah and Mary see on their way to the park?
column16: A squirrel, a yellow bird, and pink flowers
column18: A pink squirrel, a bird, and yellow flowers
column19: multiple: What did Hannah and Mary do when they were bored?
column22: Petted the cat and drew pictures

column3:
Douglas loves to play soccer. He plays for the Dolphins. He is very good.  He was excited
ewlineabout the big game with the Lions.  The night before the game, he went to bed late.  He
ewlinewas watching three TV shows that night.  First, was Muffins the Cat.  The second show was
ewlineErnie the Talking Donkey.  The third was Laughing with Herman Hamster.  His Mom told him
ewlineto go to bed, but Douglas didn't listen.  He fell asleep on the couch. He dreamed all
ewlinenight.  First about sheep jumping fences.  Second about playing fetch the ball with
ewlineRuffles. Third about Ernie the talking Donkey kicking a soccer ball over the moon. Fourth
ewlineabout his favorite soccer player, Pele, head the ball in the goal.
ewline
ewlineFinally, the next morning, Douglas got up late because he was so tired.  His Mom called
ewlinehim and the alarm went off, but he did not hear. To get Douglas up, his Mom got Ruffles
ewlinethe dog to lick him in the face.  Douglas got up but had to eat breakfast fast.  Then he
ewlinequickly dressed into his uniform.  He was yawning.
ewline
ewlineHis Mom drove him to the soccer field.  The game had started.  Douglas had to sit out the
ewlinefirst quarter.  His team was losing one to nothing when Howard scored for the Lions.
ewlineDouglas started the second quarter.  He was tired and could not keep up with the rest of
ewlinehis team.  The coach was surprised that Douglas was so slow.  Usually he was fast.  After
ewlinethe second quarter, the Dolphins were losing two to one after Howard scored again for the
ewlineLions and Toby scored a goal for the Dolphins. While the coach gave energy drinks to the
ewlineteam, Douglas fell asleep.  The third quarter started.
ewline
ewlineDouglas was snoring when the coach told him to go in.  When he saw Douglas was sleeping,
ewlinehe sent Billy into the game.  Billy scored one goal and the Dolphins had tied the game two
ewlineto two.  Ruffles the dog started barking and then licking Douglas in the face.  Douglas
ewlinegot up and stretched.  He was finally well rested.  The coach saw Douglas and sent him
ewlineinto the game.  Douglas remembered his dream.  In the last second, he headed the ball in
ewlinethe goal like Pele. He won the game. The team cheered.
ewline
ewlineSince that time, Douglas goes to bed on time.  He always wants to be well rested.  His Mom
ewlinewas right.  He gave her a hug.
column4: multiple: What dream helped Douglas win the game?
column5: He dreamed about Ernie the donkey kick the ball over the moon.
column6: He dreamed about Pele heading the ball in the goal.
column7: He dreamed about Ruffles fetching the ball.
column8: He dreamed about sheep jumping over fences.
column9: one: Who woke Douglas up by licking him in the face?
column14: multiple: How many points did the Dolphins score and who scored the goals?
column15: They scored two points.  Ruffles and Billy scored.
column16: They scored three points.  Toby, Billy and Douglas scored.
column17: They scored five points. Howard, Billy, Ruffles, Douglas, and Billy scored.
column18: They scored one point.  Toby scored.

column3:
I'm here to tell you the story of a robot named Carl. He came from a far away land known as
ewlineFactory. Carl was sad because he was missing a part called a tire. He also needed a sun
ewlinegatherer. But, the tire was more important. Once Carl got all these parts he could travel
ewlineto his new home in the nation of Lab and the city of Office. It was a tricky thing to get
ewlinethere with missing parts. Just as he had given up hope Carl got a message from Mr. X
ewlinesaying the new parts were ready to be delivered. This made the robot very happy. The parts
ewlinearrived a few days later and Carl put them in with 2 days of work. After this Carl began
ewlineto travel the last bit of his goal to get to his new job. After this Carl took 10 days to
ewlineget to Lab.

column3:
On a hot summer day, Brian was walking home from the park. While walking, Brian passed his
ewlinefavorite toy store, and saw that they had a new baseball glove in the window.  Brian's
ewlinebaseball glove was very old and was ripped in a few places.  Brian really wanted the new
ewlineglove because he wanted to show off his glove to his friends tomorrow. The cost of the
ewlinenew glove was fifteen dollars, but when Brian checked his pockets for money, he only had
ewlinesix dollars and fifty cents.  Brian ran home and went to look around his house for money.
ewlineHe checked under his bed and found fifty cents under some toys.  He then checked all of
ewlinehis pockets of his pants and shorts, and found another two dollars.  Brian then went to
ewlinelook between the cushions on all of the couches in his house, and he found another three
ewlinedollars.  After finally looking around his whole house, Brian knew that he still did not
ewlinehave enough money to buy the new glove.  Brian went outside and saw his dad doing yard
ewlinework. He told his dad that he would finish all the yard work for him, if he could have the
ewlinemoney he needed for the new glove.  His dad said yes, so Brian spent the rest of the
ewlineafternoon raking the yard, and bagging leaves.  Brian's dad was very proud that his son
ewlinewas working hard for money. When Brian was finally done, Brian knew that he was too
ewlinelate, and the toy store was closed.  Just as Brian was walking inside, he saw his dad walk
ewlineup to home holding the new glove that he wanted.  Brian was so happy, and he and his dad
ewlinespent the rest of the afternoon having a catch.
column4: one: Why did Brian dad buy him the glove?
column5: His dad wanted to him to practice.
column6: His dad didn't want him to use his old glove.
column7: His dad was proud that he was working hard.
column8: His dad knew that he really wanted it in order to show off his friends.
column9: one: How much money did Brian find under his bed?
column14: multiple: Why did Brian want a new glove?
column15: So he could show it off to his friends.
column16: He did not have any baseball glove.
column17: He lost his old baseball glove.
column18: So he could have a catch with his dad.
column19: multiple: How much money did Brian have in total after looking in his house?

column3:
On a nice and sunny day, Bob and Sally walked to the beach. When they got there, the first
ewlinething they wanted to do was to look for buried treasure. To find the treasure they had
ewlinebrought two shovels and two buckets. They both started digging holes in the sand with
ewlinetheir shovels. After looking very hard for treasure for an hour, they didn't find
ewlineanything. This made Bob and Sally very sad. They gave up and went to play in the
ewlinewater. While they were playing in the water, Sally found a bottle with a little paper
ewlineinside. Sally opened the bottle and found a treasure map. Sally showed the map to Bob and
ewlinethey started to look for the treasure.  After walking every step that the map said, they
ewlinestarted digging with their shovels. After digging a really a big hole, they found a
ewlinebox. They were very happy that they found it and wanted to see what was inside. Bob slowly
ewlineopened the box and there was a very big pearl.  Next, they ran to a special store to ask
ewlineabout the pearl. The worker in the store told Bob and Sally that the pearl could make them
ewlinerich. Bob and Sally looked at each other and decided not to sell it. They took the pearl
ewlinehome and saved it in a special box, so they could remember their day at the beach.
column4: one: What did Bob and Sally find in the box?
column9: one: What did Sally find in the water?
column14: multiple: What did Bob and Sally do after they showed the pearl to the worker?
column16: They left it at the beach.
column19: multiple: Why did Bob and Sally stop looking for the treasure?
column20: They were sad at not finding anything.
column21: They forgot to bring a shovel.
column22: They did not want to find the treasure.

column3:
It was a beautiful sunny and warm day. I was working outside in my garden. I was pulling
ewlineweeds which is not my favorite job, but I was enjoying the day. I live by a lake so
ewlinesometimes I take a break from my chores and look at the lake. It is so beautiful and it
ewlinemakes me happy to look at the beautiful lake and see what animals I can find swimming in
ewlineor near the lake.
ewline
ewlineOn this day, I kept hearing a low soft sound coming from the lake. I got up from my garden
ewlineand walked to the lake. I kept hearing this strange sound. It sounded like someone talking
ewlinein a very low voice. I thought it might be a lake bird because we see and hear them all of
ewlinethe time. The lake birds have several different calls that tell what they want to "say" to
ewlineother lake birds. There is the call when they are flying which is very hurried and
ewlineshort. Then there is the "where are you" call which is long, slow and loud. But this sound
ewlinewas not like any I had ever heard. I went to get the binoculars to see if I could spot
ewlineanything. But, no luck. I still kept hearing this low talking sound. I had now totally
ewlinegiven up weeding. Finding this strange sound was going to be more fun. But where was it
ewlinecoming from? I looked again up and down the lake and saw nothing. Finally I went around to
ewlinethe other side of the place where we keep our boats. There is an area there where it is
ewlinenot a very deep part of the water. I spotted them! It was a mother lake bird and a father
ewlinelake bird with a baby in between them. They were teaching the baby how to swim and eat
ewlinefish. The low talking sound that I heard must have been them trying to teach the baby to
ewlineswim and eat the fish. I sat there on the bank and watched for a half an hour. I felt very
ewlinespecial that I got to see this. It was such a fun thing to see and way more fun than
ewlinegardening.
column4: one: What was I doing on this day at the beginning of the story?
column9: one: What did I finally see?
column14: multiple: What was the sound that I kept hearing?
column16: something that sounded like low talking
column19: multiple: How did I feel at the end of the story?

column3:
One day Magneson took a walk in the park.  He passed some trees and a pond.  In the pond
ewlinewas a duck named George.  George's wife was also in the pond.  Her name was Nancy.
ewline
ewlineMagneson walked over to the tree.  Nancy flew up into the tree.  She wanted to warn
ewlineMagneson about the killer squirrel who lived inside of the tree.  A few years before, the
ewlinesquirrel had thrown a chestnut at George and Nancy's son.  He was knocked out, and the
ewlinesquirrel took him away.  He was never seen again.
ewline
ewlineMagneson asked what their son's name was.  They said it was Leonard.  But Magneson was
ewlineonly making small talk.  He didn't believe the story about the killer squirrel.  Even if
ewlinethere was one, there were many rocks by the pond that he could throw at the squirrel.  He
ewlinecould also hide in the tall grass.
ewline
ewlineGeorge and Nancy were sorry to see that Magneson wouldn't listen.  They flew away, singing
ewlinea sad song.  A short time later, the squirrel came out of the tree and threw a giant
ewlinewalnut at Magneson.  No one ever saw Magneson again.
column4: multiple: What was George's wife's name?
column9: multiple: Who did the squirrel throw things at?
column14: one: What did the squirrel throw at Magneson?
column19: one: Where did Magneson walk?

column3:
Every Monday morning, the little bad boy named Josh goes to school.
ewline
ewlineSuddenly, little Josh slips on a banana skin ...
ewline
ewline- Ouch, says Josh, I fell on this and in addition I got a bump on the forehead!
ewline
ewline- Wonderful! said the banana peel. I am Mary. I turned into banana skin after throwing trash on the school yard. You have saved me and now I'm back to good old Mary. What's your name?
ewline
ewline- Mine is Josh... I'm a late to class ... are you serious, where is the banana peel anyways?
ewline
ewline- The Banana, my dear Josh, was eaten by me, I threw the banana peel and turned into one ... now you saved me, can you see the banana peel you slipped on around here?
ewline
ewline- No, you are right.
ewline
ewline- Mary said:  Josh, Thank you
ewline
ewline- Excuse me, Mary ... I have to go ... Otherwise I'll be late for school ... And I would not want to upset the teacher.
column4: one: Who slipped on a banana skin?
column9: multiple: Why Josh was in such a hurry?
column10: Josh had a soccer game to play.
column12: Josh was heading to the school yard.
column14: one: Who turned into banana skin after throwing trash on the school yard?
column19: multiple: Who are the principal characters of the story

column3:
Once there was a young boy named Bret who had a cat named Wolfgang.  The boy had really
ewlinewanted a wolf for a pet, but his mother said wolves liked to hog the bathroom and liked
ewlineto blow things down and they snored.  So the boy had to call his cat Wolfie.
ewline
ewlineHe had also thought about naming his cat Sir Purrsalot.  Bret himself planned to become a
ewlineknight when he grew up (or maybe a cowboy) and thought Sir Purrsalot sounded like a good
ewlinename for his brother knight.  The difficulty there was that Wolfie didn't purr a lot.  He
ewlinepurred when he was being fed or petted, but no one could say he purred a lot.  Plus Bret's
ewlinemother said knights liked to poke things with their swords and they also liked to hog the
ewlinebathroom and they clanked.
ewline
ewlineSo Bret was left with a cat named Wolfgang.  The neighbors gave him strange looks when he
ewlinestood in the front yard in the evening and yelled "Wolfie!  Here Wolfie!!!", to get
ewlineWolfgang to come in for the night.  But Bret didn't care what anyone else thought.  He had
ewlinea Wolfie and maybe he'd end up becoming a pet doctor when he grew up instead.
column4: multiple: When did Wolfie purr?
column9: multiple: What was the name of the cat?
column14: one: What was one reasong his mother didn't like knights?
column19: one: What was one reason his mother didn't like wolves?

column3:
Sally liked going outside.  She put on her shoes. She went outside to walk.  She walked on
ewlinethe green grass.  The sun was warm.  The trees were tall. The birds sang in the trees.
ewlineSally liked how the birds can sing.  Sally likes to sing with the birds, outside.  Ring,
ewlinering, is how the birds sang. Sally sang ring, ring, with the birds in the trees. Sally
ewlinetook off her shoes.  Sally liked how the green grass was on her toes.  Sally's toes liked
ewlinethe green grass.  Sally walked on the green grass some more.  She saw Missy the cat.
ewlineMissy the cat meowed to Sally.  Sally waved to Missy the cat.  Sally likes Missy the cat.
ewlineSally likes to meow to Missy the cat.  Meow, meow, Sally says to Missy the cat. Missy the
ewlinecat walks away from Sally.  Sally hears her name.  Sally, Sally, come home, Sally's Mom
ewlinecalls out.  Sally runs home to her Mom.  Sally liked going outside.
column4: multiple: Why did Sally put on her shoes?
column5: To wave to Missy the cat
column7: Because she wanted to go outside
column9: one: What did Sally like to do?
column14: one: What was the name of the cat?
column19: multiple: Who called Sally?

column3:
Tammy likes the park. There are swings at the park. There is a slide at the park.  
ewline
ewlineMary goes to the park with Tammy. They jump rope. They play tag. They like the park.
ewline
ewlineTammy and Mary have fun at the park. Tammy has a dog named Max. Tammy and Mary take Max to the park.
ewline
ewlineMax likes the park. He chases rabbits. He chases a ball. Tammy throws the ball to Max. Mary throws the ball to Max.
ewline
ewlineThe park is no fun in the rain. Tammy and Mary cannot go to the park when it rains. Mother
ewlinesays no. They are sad when they cannot go to the park.
ewline
ewlineTammy and Mary play in the house when it rains. They play with dolls. They dress up and
ewlinehave a tea party.
ewline
ewlineToday is sunny. Tammy and Mary can go to the park. Mother says yes. They can take Max to
ewlinethe park. They are happy when it is sunny.
column4: one: Who has a dog?
column9: multiple: What do Tammy and Mary do when it rains?
column11: Play with dolls, have a tea party
column14: multiple: Who likes to go to the park?
column19: one: What is the the name of the dog?

column3:
Once upon a time, there was a dog named Puddles. Puddles was lonely because he lived in an
ewlinearea where there were no other dogs, but only cats. Day after day, Puddles would have to
ewlineeat cat food and do cat things in order to fit in with the rest of his group. He found it
ewlinevery boring and Puddles was sad. Puddles didn't even look like a cat!
ewline
ewlineAll of the other cats teased Puddles. "You're too big," they said. "You've got too long of
ewlinea nose!" "Why are you panting like that?" Puddles knew that he was different.
ewline
ewlineOne day, Puddles chose to run away from all of the cats. The cats laughed at him. What a
ewlinestupid dog! Didn't he know that there were monsters in the woods that could eat him?
ewlinePuddles didn't care, because Puddles was sad enough to try.
ewline
ewlineSo Puddles packed up his things - his squeaky ball, his water dish, and his bone - and
ewlineheaded off into the woods. He was finally happy! All of a sudden, Puddles turned. He
ewlinesmelled a funny smell. It smelled like something he had never smelled before. He turned
ewlinearound, and what did he see but another dog!
ewline
ewlinePuddles was so happy, he barked with joy. He went home with the other dog, who was named
ewlineMittens, and to his family. Puddles was never lonely again.
column4: multiple: Why did the cats not like him?
column9: one: Where did Puddles live in the beginning?
column14: multiple: What does Puddles choose to do?
column19: one: Who did Puddles find?

column3:
Once upon a time there was a princess who lived in a high tower and she was not allowed to
ewlineleave because of her mean mother. One day she chose to leave but her mother would not let
ewlineher. The princess climbed out the window of the high tower and climbed down the south wall
ewlinewhen her mother was sleeping. She wandered out a good ways. Finally she went into the
ewlineforest where there are no electric poles but where there are some caves.  There she met a
ewlineyoung man who was running. His name was John. John asked the princess why such a beautiful
ewlinewoman like her was out in the middle of a forest. She said that she had been trapped for
ewlineher whole life by an evil woman who said she was her mother. The man said that he would
ewlinetake the princess to a castle that was near. He also said that he thought that she may be
ewlinethe missing princess. As they go through the forest they run into many problems. They see
ewlinethat they are lost and have no way of finding where to go. After several days pass, the
ewlineprincess climbs up to the top of a tree in order to find out where they are. She sees that
ewlinethe castle where they want to go is not that far away and near a mountain. After thinking
ewlineof the best way to get there, John and the princess go to the castle where they live for
ewlinethe rest of their lives.
column4: multiple: Where did the princess wander to after escaping?
column9: one: Who escaped from the tower?
column14: multiple: What did the princess climb to see the castle?
column19: one: Where does the princess live in the beginning?
